question.questionText: A harp has strings of different lengths. Describe how the sound of a short string being plucked (pulled and let go quickly) is different from the sound of a long string being plucked.

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: If the string is shorter, the pitch will be higher. If the string is longer, the pitch will be lower.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: The short string has a higher pitch sound.
The lower pitch make's the loudest noise.
The shorter the string the higher the pitch the Longer the string the lower the pitch.
The shorter string has a higher pitch than the longer string!
